author: alexp7
title: Token Allies, Latam Businesses
description: In LatinAmerica, It is very hard for businesses and start ups to get quick and easy access to funding, impeding many great ideas to be real.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal was present, if I'm not mistaken, at f6, but the objective was just to create a platform that would facilitate the management of tokens by companies. The current objective would be to help small entrepreneurs/companies to fund their businesses through crowdfunding. The author problematizes the context of the problem well: Latin America is a very extensive and diverse territory, it is difficult to stand out and also start from scratch, there are not many financing opportunities and small businesses need help to be developed well. Therefore, I think the idea of ​​creating a platform that can help companies to create/sell/manage their tokens is very relevant, and this would certainly benefit the Cardano ecosystem, as it would increase the circulation of assets minted in our blockchain. It is positive that the authors explain how they would be able to use their platforms: not only for a single audience, but for start ups and investors in general. They are also concerned with making it very clear how the proposal achieves the challenge's objectives: promoting investment in ADA in Latin American entrepreneurs, benefiting at the same time the continent and Cardano. I believe it is a proposal that meets what was requested very well.
f6_assessments.q1: The duo of authors seem very well prepared to carry out this project, they provide us with very detailed and varied information about who they are, what they have done professionally so far, their connections with the blockchain Cardano (which are strong, which is a very positive point) and their linkedin profiles, giving us the chance to know even more about their work. With that, we have complete confidence in your preparation to successfully execute this proposal. Through the topics "general milestones", we can have a notion of how the development process of this project would take place. However I found this information very superficial, the authors spend a lot of time talking about the need for their initiative and also how Token Allies, the halving and pledge model, etc., would work. But, unfortunately, they don't pay that much attention to the script. The activities are divided into 3 phases, which are the quarter of 2022, but there is no in-depth explanation of each step, on the contrary, we only have a sentence explaining what would be done... But we would need to understand the details, such as, the order of things, who would do what, subtopics I would say. It is not possible to have a good visualization of the process based on the details provided. And about the financial division, I believe there was also a lack of detail. For example, there is a part that the authors say: "-$7,000 will go towards server costs, legal services and marketing". How much would go for each thing? It's because? What legal services would be needed? How would marketing strategies take place and why would they cost how much? I believe that there is no lack of detail when it comes to the salaries of those involved because the information is already self-sufficient, but in this second topic, yes.
f6_assessments.q2: This part of the proposal was very well covered, the authors were concerned with establishing success metrics and KPIs, thus we have precise information to be analyzed in auditability. I think it would be interesting if the team presented the partial results to the community, such as the launch of the beta version of the platform, and gradually brought more and more of this feedback; we need to understand exactly if the promised financing was fulfilled, if the Latin American businessmen were, in fact, benefited, in other words, if the platform is having a proper functioning. Another way to measure how the proposal was developing would be through direct contact with businessmen and investors: has this initiative had a real impact on their lives? if so, in what way? What could be improved? It would also be interesting for the Cardano community, especially in Latin America, to use the portal and test first hand if everything that was planned was delivered. So, I believe so, it is a highly auditable proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal addresses directly the challenge. If this model proves to be successful, it could be implemented on global scale, as a funding platform for small/private businesses.
f6_assessments.q1:
All information provided, including full deployed project web site, are easily accessible from the proposals page.
The initial token listing and the platform prototype is expected to be developed in January 2022.
f6_assessments.q2:
The examples of metrics to be taken into account for auditing the projects seem comprehensive, streching from Q1-Q3 2022.
I agree that it is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.

f6_assessments.q0: The issue being it is tough for startups and businesses in LATAM to get access to the funding and it is stopping many great ideas being real. The proposer will be providing a platform from which startups and businesses in LATAM can Create manage and sell their own business tokens. This proposal effectively addresses the challenge
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer's team have experience doing business in Latin America and have enough knowledge about the field. They have also provided a complete plan on how the proposal will be implemented. They have also given a complete roadmaps each will time targets. With all these details It will very much possible the proposal will be implemented successfully
f6_assessments.q2: The prosper has provided the Milestones to achieve within the time period. Also given a detailed budget allocation for each expenses with key performance indicators. The proposal also consist of step by step timeline hence all these information should be enough to track the success of the proposal

f6_assessments.q0: This token allies proposal will provide a platform for  Latin America Businesses to raise fund by letting them create, sell and manage their own tokens. This will help to increase adoption of Cardano in Latin America.
f6_assessments.q1: The 2 proposers have a great mix of experiences. Lucas liaise with Latin America businesses and Alex has experience in develop technical solutions and an active community member in Catalyst. I would give them 5 star if they address about potential risk and challenges they will face. They mentioned about  halving and pledging of businesses on the platform which is great to protect the investors who give their pledges to businesses.
f6_assessments.q2: The KPIs and roadmap are mentioned in the proposal. I would appreciate more detail breakdown, for example, the Allie coins will be launched in Q1: how much is the funding will go towards making that happened. What would be the extra features that they will introduce in Q2 and how much would that cost. It would give the community more confidence to track the progress and see it through the success of this proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal sets out to make it quick and easy for businesses and startups in Latinamerica to access capital. It can be added that this has a positive impact on the Cardano ecosystem. Provide a platform where businesses and startups from Latam will be able to easily create, manage and sell their business tokens. Problem and solution statements are reasonable and within the scope of the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
This is a proposal that quality and enthusiastic team members who can successfully achieve their goals in my opinion
The plan is presented in a really optimal way, it is very likely that this proposal is successfully implemented in the way that the proponents describe. There is no doubt about the success of the proposal, what they demonstrate what they do, what they do. I completely agree with this suggestion.
f6_assessments.q2:
Proponents provide a clear definition of success and a roadmap with milestones. Clear launch date and roadmap with milestones
It's good that the recommendation team included some pretty useful KPIs to allow us to see how helpful previous work was. The data provided can easily be made available to test and monitor the process in promises
The stated budget is reasonable enough and it makes me completely agree that the team is competent enough to tackle the challenge. Clear and reasonable budget allocation

f6_assessments.q0: The solution is not so different from Cardano Funding Platform: provide crowdfunding for all, provide ADA for ideas that proves potential. However, it might be a good way to make Cardano Catalyst community more popular in LatinAmerica.
f6_assessments.q1: The team members have relevant experience and show their enthusiam in the proposal (The proposal is very well-written and informative). It includes information about each team member, road map in detail etc. They even plan for the longterm, which shows their vision for the project. Their LATAM business and community is a good resource that they can make use of.
f6_assessments.q2: The Road Map and KPIs are very detail. It makes the project become easy to audit the progress and measure the success.

solution: We aim to provide a platform where businesses and start ups from LATAM will be able to easily create, manage and sell their business tokens.
experience: 2 Argentinian partners. Been doing businesses in LATAM for many years, experienced in constrained situations. Catalyst active members.
